creator: gabrio@teamperfecto.com
text:
hello

i am running the following system:

p3 1.0 ghz, QDI advance 10b, 768 mb ram @ 133 mhz, 2 x 80 gb WD EIDE, ATI 
radeon 32 mb on windows 2000 server version.

i have installed apache_2.0.53-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi and after doing this, the 
problems started to arise. i have installed apache and then ive installed mysql-
essential-4.1.10-win32.msi and php-5.0.3-installer.exe and i think also php-
5.0.3-Win32.zip since i wanted to have php + sql + apache running at the same 
time and i didn't find an overall package altho i know they do exist.

so i tried running all that together and apparently it was running, but soon 
after that apache started to become unstable, didnt want to start (options were 
good), like if at startup it wouldn't load, then i couldn't 'restart' the 
server, so i had to restart the whole machine...

then i have given up since often after working and with apache running i was 
getting the blue screen of death, actually i dont remember the exact error i 
was receiving. so i uninstalled everything, php, apache and sql.

everything apparently went smooth (un-install process) but then i noticed the 
following:

1) apache 2 wasn't completely un-installed, i found in the registry a legacy2 
key which is still connected with apache and there's no way i can delete that, 
i have also tried to run in safe mode which usually always works, but i 
couldn't delete that key either.

but this wouldn't be really an issue...i can live with that....the REAL ISSUE 
is that now the computer goes in blue screen and PAGE FAULT IN NON PAGED AREA 
quite frequently, and this started to happen exactly since i un-installed 
apache 2, so i think that it made some major fuckup. i ofcourse get a memory 
address error.

i have then thought it could be a RAM issue, so i have tried to swap several 
ram modules i have here, but the problem is still there and i am quite lost 
right now.

if you are aware of any fix i can do or something i can change in order to have 
this not happening again, please advise.

right now i have re-installed apache, even though i am not using it, because i 
think that maybe windows needs something which i had uninstalled (and that 
cannot be removed) so maybe this way it will work.

but i would like to know if you have any ideas before spending 1-2 days for 
redoing the entire machine which i need for work, and working like this for me 
it's impossible.

thanks and sorry for the long email.

kind regards

gabrio - team perfecto

email gabrio@teamperfecto.com
msn gabrio@teamperfecto.com
icq #132516819

creator: the_angry_angel@blueyonder.co.uk
text:
The non-paged area of memory is the memory used by windows to store the vitals
of the operating system, plus anything else third parties decide is important
(such as norton). As far as I am aware, apache does nothing to add itself to
this exclusive list which would normally cause this.

You might want to try running a quick memtest (you're correct this is usually a
RAM problem) on the box (if you can), as it's likely this is a coincidence and
check to see if any other third party applications have been installed around
about the same time. 

Given the fact that you're running on older hardware, it could be that you may
have some other faulty components within the machine, perhaps?
This is quite old. Please test/confirm with more recent versions and reopen if needed.
creator: jim@apache.org
